sentences.sContent: Pretending he doesn’t remember is an old trick of his.
sentences.sCn: 假装不记得是他的老花招了。

sentences.sContent: He didn’t really lose his wallet - that’s just a trick.
sentences.sCn: 他并没有真的丢了钱包——这只是一个骗局。

sentences.sContent: I’m getting tired of your silly tricks.
sentences.sCn: 我对你那些愚蠢的恶作剧感到厌烦了。

sentences.sContent: The trick is to bend your knees as you catch the ball.
She knew she’d been tricked, but it was too late.
sentences.sCn: 她知道自己被骗了，但为时已晚。

synos.tran: 诡计；恶作剧；窍门；花招；骗局；欺诈
[电影]特技的；欺诈的；有决窍的

phrases.pCn: 不招待就使坏（指万圣节孩子们挨家逐户要糖果等礼物，如不遂愿便恶作剧一番的风俗）
帽子戏法（指连入三球），[板球]连中三柱（使对方三击球手退场）
高明的把戏；聪明的花招；熟练的伎俩

words.tran: 欺骗的，狡猾的；恶作剧的；顽皮的
诡计多端；狡猾；棘手；欺骗

remMethod.val: 万圣节(Halloween)前夕， 孩子们喜欢玩一种叫treat or trick(不给糖就捣乱)的游戏

trans.tranOther: something you do in order to deceive someone
to deceive someone in order to get something from them or to make them do something
